definition: see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
barn/granary/storehouse/cabin/hold (in ship)
to rescue
to rob/looting
emergency (measures)/to react to an emergency
to repair in a rush/rush repairs
to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
to seize (the strategic high ground)
to plunder/to pillage/to forcibly take
to fight desperately (at the risk of one's life)
to fight over/to scramble for
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
(of goods) popular/in great demand
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
looting

sentences.english: Quality image, brand name benefit, do the proven route, right-time & right-place development.
sentences.chinese: 树精品意识，创品牌效益，走规模道路，抢时机发展？

sentences.english: Put in the stack, and grab cakes served in the three new mini games.
sentences.chinese: 放在堆栈，抢蛋糕服务三个新的迷你游戏。

sentences.english: I can rebound and I can score occasionally.
sentences.chinese: 我偶尔能够抢到篮板球或投篮得分。

sentences.english: You know, I want to grab to eat.
sentences.chinese: 你知道吗，我是想去抢来吃的。

sentences.english: I think Josh is probably a better perimeter shooter and rebounder than Ronny.
sentences.chinese: 我认为约什在投篮和抢篮板球能力上比罗尼更好些。

sentences.english: Italian football clubs are queuing up to sign the young star.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的足球俱乐部都抢着要与这个年轻球星签约。

sentences.english: Learn how to escape a single wrist grab in this free video on kid's self-defense.
sentences.chinese: 了解如何摆脱在这个免费视频单手腕孩子的自卫抢。

sentences.english: They robbed him of his money.
She had her handbag robbed in the daytime.
sentences.chinese: 她的手提包在大白天里给人抢去了。

sentences.english: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 我打破不义之人的牙床，从他牙齿中夺了所抢的。

sentences.english: The bank around the corner was knocked over last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜里位于拐角的那家银行被抢了。

sentences.english: Who has the brain and money to stage this smash-and-grab?
sentences.chinese: 谁有脑力和财力策划这场砸了就抢的案子？

sentences.english: And mine boost clothes, sell 'dro, got the blow cheap.
sentences.chinese: 我抢衣服，卖毒品，能搞到便宜的可卡因。

sentences.english: Will you take my son's mandrakes too?
sentences.chinese: 难道现在你还要把我儿子的多情果也抢去吗？

sentences.english: I was holdupped with a pistol and robbed of money.
sentences.chinese: 我被枪指着举起手来，钱就被抢了。

sentences.english: No road team has won a title in Game 7 since 1978.
sentences.chinese: 自从1978年久没有一支客队能在抢七大战中赢球。

definition: to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
to fight over/to scramble for
to plunder/to pillage/to forcibly take
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
to take possession of/to get hold of
to take away
to steal/to pilfer/to snatch/thief/stealthily
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
old variant of 拿[na2]
variant of 拿[na2]
advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
looting
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to buy/to purchase
